intro: Erigeron arachnoideus, commonly known as the spiderhead fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its woolly, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, daisy-like white or pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Erigeron arachnoideus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
